data.title: Support variables in snippets
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10

Is there anyway to get the filename from a snippet? Something like

```
"Test snippet": {
    "prefix": "test",
    "body": [
        "this is a test snippet",
        "file: $FILENAME"
    ],
    "description": "Test snippet"
}
```

data.title: Dark+ theme needs some improvements for type, cast and return type annotations
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Used latest vscode extension from https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.typescript-javascript-grammar

This can also be found when using extension https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.js-atom-grammar

Complete typeannotation is colorized as green in Dark+ theme probably because of `meta.return.type, meta.type.annotation and meta.cast` in 

```
                                {
                                                "name": "Types declaration and references",
                                                "scope": [
                                                                "meta.type.name",
                                                                "meta.return.type",
                                                                "meta.return-type",
                                                                "meta.cast",
                                                                "meta.type.annotation",
                                                                "support.type",
                                                                "entity.name.class",
                                                                "entity.name.type",
                                                                "storage.type.cs",
                                                                "storage.type.java"
                                                ],
                                                "settings": {
                                                                "foreground": "#4EC9B0"
                                                }
                                },

```

As reported by @octref in Microsoft/TypeScript-TmLanguage#273
Previously I could at least tell primitives from other constructs, and have a nested object displayed fine...

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/18942421/cc71fbbc-85cd-11e6-8360-7941b205d591.png)

Now this looks terrible:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/18942434/e46284c6-85cd-11e6-9109-3600f6bdfd9e.png)

data.title: editor.lineNumbers description needs to be updated for "on", "off", "relative"
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version:Windows 10

From Default Settings:
    // Controls visibility of line numbers
    "editor.lineNumbers": "on",

Should be something like:
"Controls display of line numbers. Possible values are "on", "off", and "relative". The "relative" options shows the line count relative to the current cursor position."

data.title: Dark+ theme needs some improvements for 'variable.language' scope
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Used latest vscode extension from https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.typescript-javascript-grammar

This can also be found when using extension https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.js-atom-grammar

data.title: New up/down search input box keybindings are not symmetric
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

The "up" keybinding is missing the "!searchInputBoxFocus" condition that is in "down".
Not sure if this is an oversight with commit https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/a9b91a0a8af40e4128d800a3ec740cb48a8d4f44 or by design.

Windows keybindings show:

{ "key": "down",                  "command": "search.focus.nextInputBox",
                                     "when": "inputBoxFocus && searchViewletVisible" },
{ "key": "up",                    "command": "search.focus.previousInputbox",
                                     "when": "inputBoxFocus && searchViewletVisible && !searchInputBoxFocus" },

data.title: Files Opening Behind Other Applications
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: WIndows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. When using "Open with Code" from right click dialog in Windows Explorer, VS Code opens up the file behind all other open applications. This occurs if VS Code already has other open windows.

data.title: New action search.focus.previousInputbox should be search.focus.previousInputBox
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version:Windows 10

The new action should keep with camel casing used elsewhere for InputBox, ex. search.focus.nextInputBox

data.title: Unpublish test extensions
data.body:
I can imagine someone searching for extensions related to testing, and this doesn't look that great... I think we should unpublish these when we're done with them or they'll just pile up.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/18971394/beb4dd10-8649-11e6-8890-8f2a24952888.png)

data.title: No div completion on Template literals inside of ES6/TS files
data.body:
More of a feature request than a bug, but Sublime Text can handle auto-creating div's through the div.someclass syntax inside of Template literals, just wondering if it could be added to VSCode.

Cheers

data.title: Hang in file dialog when trying to save untitled file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hit CTRL + N to create a new file.
2. Immediately hit CTRL + S to save the new file. The save dialog comes up as a white box and never unfreezes. VS Code is unresponsive, and force quit is necessary, which closes all instances of VS Code.

*This only happens sometimes. I have had it happen at least 10x over the past couple months. I haven't been able to put my foot on what causes it. I'm always in split screen. I always have several instances of VS Code open. I have no idea if those things affect it.

data.title: Support msys git

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.title: Add option to enable listing of files only from current working folder when using quick search

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0-insider Commit c94c824db64a88bd4909da2e84e44316dbf8e8fb
- OS Version: ubuntu 16.04

Currently when using quick search recently opened files from other folder than the one you have currently opened in your workspace are also listed. If one is working on multiple projects with similar file names and switch between the two you often end up opening and modifying the file from other folder.

So it would be nice to have a setting using which one can make quick search list files only from folder currently opened in workspace. Ideally this should be default behavior.

data.title: Disable experimental auto build setting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: all

See the discussions in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12511 why we need to disable it. There were at least one user that enabled it but without the right tsserver no errors will be reported. Took quite some time to track this down.

Dark+ theme needs some improvements for 'support' scope
Duplicate definition warning for Interface defined in same file - C#
Text typed in left editor is inserted in right editor when focused (HTML files)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Mac OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create two HTML files. 
2. Split edit HTML files
3. Place cursor at the beginning of right editor file
4. Type in left editor
5. Give focus to right editor

**Actual**
Text typed in left editor is inserted in right editor.

**Expected**
Focus is given to right editor

See attached gif for visual repro.
![vscodebug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1385823/18966908/64fe63b2-8640-11e6-9780-35ce0387afe6.gif)

data.title: Put privacy link behind FWD link
data.body: We had this [issue](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12763). It is expedient to place the privacy link behind a FWD link.

data.title: Win7: CPU usage at 100% when opening huge files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3 (1.5.3)
- OS Version: Win7 64 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I opened a file rollup.js has transpiled just now. The file was about 16000+ LoC. Syntax coloring was active.
2. Then VScode became very unresponsive. It took me 2 minutes to close the file. I don't saw the typical 'keep waiting or close' message.
3. In Process Explorer saw that a VScode process consumed 100% of a single CPU core.

![64f82052-864e-11e6-9b93-06bc3837872e](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/623932/18965017/add5851c-867b-11e6-9e0a-3371d1dc231f.png)

data.title: Full file path to clipboard
data.body: Actually it's not a bug. It should be nice to have the "Full file path to clipboard" when right clicking a tab.

data.title: Feature Request: Selection within words
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T13:06:49.879Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.0.0

SublimeText supports, not only selecting whole words, but selecting parts of words. For example, given the term someSnakeCaseWord: Whole word selection would select the entire term. Partial selection would select the next "portion." If the cursor was to the left of "some", then the first partial selection would select "some," the next "Snake," then "Case," and finally "Word." It's _very_ handy when modifying like named terms.

data.title: Keyword 'new' as object property access and TypeScript highlighting
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

```
Version 1.5.1
Commit 07d663dc1bd848161edf4cd4ce30cce410d3d877
Date 2016-09-08T21:34:58.760Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0
```
- OS Version:
  Ubuntu 14.04.4 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. in TS file create some object with `new` property
2. write some code to access this property
3. see wrong highlighting after this line (look at `public isReview` color)
   ![_864](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1944061/18961665/6f9f8cc0-8676-11e6-893d-8648fcfe1e9b.png)
